subject.topic: Anti-democracy impulses: Slavery, free people of color, and Removal of Native Americans .

mods.note: "A Favorite Ethiopian Song [amp] Chorus" is listed on the cover along with the pencil inscriptions "Presented to Nora Lee by Dundard" at the top, and "Nora Lee Gardner Oakland Tennessee" at the bottom. This song written in slave dialect laments the loss of a child who was "stole away." Included in a bound volume of sheet music owned by Miss Nora Gardner of Tennessee.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guidelines (Version 3.5).
